's central region, 520km north of the capital. It was first established in 1932 at the junction of the rivers Bystraya and Uksichan.

In the language of Even people "Esso" stands for larch-tree. If you are enjoy warmer temperatures, August and September are the best-advised months for you to visit. If you prefer cold weather then you may enjoy sightseeing all year long, especially in the winter when local geothermal sources such as the hot springs are most enjoyable. The abundance of hot water has supposedly caused the locals to give the place the nickname "Kamchatka Switzerland". Interestingly enough, hot springs are also used for heating homes in Esso.
You can get to Esso from
by car or public bus. The journey lasts roughly 10 hours. The road is gravel so you'll need some stamina.
You will mostly get around by foot,  and less so by half-track and helicopter. Dogsleds and horses are a must vehicle here.

value: has a vast collection of ethnic clothes, utensils and religious artifacts.
Ethnic music groups performing traditional Koryak, Even, and Evenki songs.
Dogsledding - It is the main means of transport in the village.
Hot springs - Large and small pools are available in all seasons.
Skijoring competition. Let the pair of dogs drive your ski and compete with all-Kamchatka champions.

The race 1980km long is listed in Guinness Book of World Records.
There are several hotels run by families or small enterprises.

value: address= Esso village, Bistrinskiy district, Zelenaya Str.10
directions=not far from the public swimming pool

content= A two story wooden house with 5 guests rooms and 12 beds, 2 bathrooms with showers, a spacious dining-room with a kitchen, a veranda, and a bath-house. Food is homemade; the owner grows her own vegetables to cook for the guests.

A number of travels are offered including day tours to see natural wonders and ethnic curiosities, rafting, horse riding, and extreme tours. Some of the tours are organized in the villages, some in Petropavlovsk.
